dataIdInfo.idPurp: This shapefile provides the geographic information of the surveyed clusters.
dataIdInfo.idAbs: The geographic datafile contains the DHS cluster ID, DHS country code, FIPS country code, FIPS region name and code (if applicable), SALB region name and code (if applicable), DHS region name and code, source type (e.g. GPS, MIS, CEN, GAZ), urban or rural classification (i.e. U or R), latitude and longitude coordinates in decimal degrees, altitude in meters from either the GPS receiver and/or a digital elevation model (DEM), and the geographic datum (i.e. WGS84).
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Implementing Organization, e.g. "Niger Institut National de la Statistique Ministère de l’Économie et des Finances Niamey" and ICF International Rockville, Maryland, USA

Consts.useLimit: Datasets are made available with the following conditions: 1) Survey data files are distributed by The Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) Program for academic research/statistical analysis. Researchers need to provide a description of any research/analysis that will be using the data, before access is granted to the datasets. 2) Once downloaded, the datasets must not be passed on to other researchers without the written consent of The DHS Program. 3) All reports and publications based on the requested data must be sent to The DHS Program Data Archive as a Portable Format Document (pdf) or a hard copy, for us to forward to the country(ies) whose data have been used.

Datasets are made available with the following conditions: 1) Survey data files are distributed by The Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) Program for academic research/statistical analysis. Researchers need to provide a description of any research/analysis that will be using the data, before access is granted to the datasets. 2) Once downloaded, the datasets must not be passed on to other researchers without the written consent of The DHS Program. 3) All reports and publications based on the requested data must be sent to The DHS Program Data Archive as a Portable Format Document (pdf) or a hard copy, for us to forward to the country(ies) whose data have been used.

attr.attrdef: 14 character DHS identification code - DHSCC & DHSYEAR & DHSCLUST (with 8 digits)
2 letter DHS country code
4 digit year of data collection
integer cluster identification number, this variable will match v001 in the DHS recode file
Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS) 2 letter country code

Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS) 2 letter country code plus 2 letter/digit first sub-national administrative division code; if this information is not available, this field will be "NULL"
Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS) first sub-national administrative division name; if this information is not available, this field will be "NULL"
Second Administrative Level Boundaries (SALB) first sub-national administrative division name; if this information is not available, this field will be "NULL"
Second Administrative Level Boundaries (SALB) first sub-national administrative division code; if this information is not available, this field will be "NULL"

First sub-national administrative division code when the DHS sample is representative at the admin 1 level, this variable will usually match v024 in the DHS recode file; if this information is not available, this field will be "9999"

First sub-national administrative division name when the DHS sample is representative at the admin 1 level, this variable will usually match v024 in the DHS recode file; if this information is not available, this field will be "NULL"
integer region code associated with the DHS region created for sampling, this variable will match either v024 or the country specific region variable in the DHS recode file
name associated with the DHS region created for sampling, this variable will match either v024 or the country specific region variable in the DHS recode file
source of data used to determine the latitude and longitude coordinates

attrvai.attrvae: “GPS” for data collected by the survey team, "CEN" for preexisting data provided by the census agency/ministry, “GAZ” for data extracted from a gazetteer of village/place names, “MAP” for data extracted from a paper map, "MIS" for clusters in which data could not be fully verified

attr.attrdef: cluster's Urban (U) and Rural (R) DHS sample classification

attrvai.attrvae: “U” for urban clusters, "R" for rural clusters

attr.attrdef: cluster's latitude coordinate in decimal degrees
cluster's longitude coordinate in decimal degrees
cluster's elevation/altitude (in meters) recorded from the GPS receiver; if this information is not available, this field will be "9999"

cluster's elevation/altitude (in meters) from the SRTM (Shuttle Radar Topography Mission) DEM (Digital Elevation Model) for the specified coordinate location, elevations are regularly spaced at 30-arc seconds or approximately 1 kilometer; if coordinates are missing, this field will be "9999"
coordinate reference system and geographic datum, it is always "WGS84" for the World Geodetic System (WGS) 1984
